intro: Teline stenopetala subsp. pauciovulata, commonly known as the narrow-petaled teline, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and finely divided, lanceolate leaves. Its small white or pale yellow flowers appear in late summer, and the plant is adapted to dry, rocky habitats. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
